title: 111-A
statement: A. Petya and Inequiationstime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutLittle Petya loves inequations. Help him findnpositive integersa1,a2, ...,an, such that the following two conditions are satisfied:a12+a22+ ... +an2≥xa1+a2+ ... +an≤yInputThe first line contains three space-separated integersn,xandy(1 ≤n≤ 105, 1 ≤x≤ 1012, 1 ≤y≤ 106).Please do not use the %lld specificator to read or write 64-bit integers in С++. It is recommended to use cin, cout streams or the %I64d specificator.OutputPrintnpositive integers that satisfy the conditions, one integer per line. If such numbers do not exist, print a single number "-1". If there are several solutions, print any of them.ExamplesInput5 15 15Output44112Input2 3 2Output-1Input1 99 11Output11

processed.result:
Given three integers $n$, $x$, and $y$ (where $1 \le n \le 10^5$, $1 \le x \le 10^{12}$, and $1 \le y \le 10^6$), find $n$ positive integers $a_1$, $a_2$, ..., $a_n$ that satisfy the following conditions:

*  $a_1^2 + a_2^2 + ... + a_n^2 \ge x$
*  $a_1 + a_2 + ... + a_n \le y$

If no such integers exist, print -1. If there are multiple solutions, print any one.
Find a set of positive numbers that add up to less than or equal to a given value and whose squares add up to at least another given value. If no such set exists, print -1.
